intro: Dryoathyrium boryanum, commonly known as the Boryanum fern, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
